noun.description: Any of numerous spiders constituting the family Pholcidae, which have relatively small bodies and very long legs.

adjective.description: Of or relating to the family Pholcidae.

origin: Late 19th century; earliest use found in Isaac Funk (1839–1912), publisher and reformer. From scientific Latin Pholcidae, family name from Pholcus, genus name + -id.
